112.appears_in: 2 p. in Moebius 1/2 (Anaheim, CA : Graphitti Designs, 1991).
notes: Summary: Tony reads in the newspaper that he and Margaret are quits; he murders her and the police find him by reading it in the newspaper.

113.heading: Giraud, Jean, 1938-
113.title: "The Grand Hotel B"
113.author: Moebius
113.appears_in: 2 p. in Moebius 1/2 (Anaheim, CA : Graphitti Designs, 1991).
notes: Summary: Two vulgar mutants row through the mud, while an inspector on the 27th underlevel finds a long-lost love.
Originally appeared in either Métal Hurlant or L'Echo des Savanes in the early 1970s; English version first appeared in Heavy Metal.

115.heading: Giraud, Jean, 1938-
115.title: Der Grosse Kristall
115.author: Giraud, Bati ; Übersetzung, Gerd Benz ; Lettering, Michael Hau.

116.heading: Giraud, Jean, 1938-
116.title: H.P.'s Rock City
116.author: by Jean "Moebius" Giraud ; translated by Randy and Jean-Marc Lofficier ; with story notes by Moebius.

117.heading: Giraud, Jean, 1938-
117.title: "Hail Darkness!"
117.author: by Alexandro Jodorowsky ; illustrated by Moebius
117.series: The Incal Light : The Further Adventures of John Difool
117.appears_in: p. 17-24 in Heavy Metal, v. 5, no. 11 (Feb. 1982).
notes: "When last we read, there was a revolution in the buried city. John Difool had no idea that the killer meta baron had been thrown onto his heels by Amok, that infamous corporation of killers and ne'eer-do-wells. While trying to escape through the technos citadel, he found himself a prisoner of the techno-pope. Needless to say, his fine-feathered sidekick, Deepo, is in no better position."

contents.author: Lee Hammock and Simon Bisley

contents.author: Jay Faerber, Ed Lee, and Andrew Robinson
contents.title: Armor testing

119.heading: Giraud, Jean, 1938-
119.title: "Happy Holidays!"
119.author: Moebius
notes: Summary: A man visits an apparent house of horrors looking for his wife and daughters who disappeared three years ago on holiday. He finds them. Originally in Hara-Kiri in 1963 or 1964 ; reprinted in Moebius 1/2 (Graphitti Designs, 1991).

127.title: "The Horny Goof"
127.author: Moebius

notes: Summary: Lady Kowalsky kidnaps the title character, also known as the "Syldanian Wild Pecker," for her own pleasure, touching off a war in which two billion die. She takes him to Flower, the pleasure asteroid.

149.author: Moebius
149.appears_in: 1 p. in Moebius 0 (Milwaukie, OR : Dark Dark Horse Comics, 1990).
notes: Summary: In the White House, the President gives David Vincent a free trip to Paris after conceding that the invaders do after all exist. France and the rest of the Earth, except the U.S., are already in the hands of the invaders.

155.heading: Giraud, Jean, 1938-
155.title: "Jeopardized!"
155.author: Moebius
notes: Summary: A cautionary fantasy about the evils of television game shows, in which nobody can remember when Columbus "sailed the ocean blue." Originally done in 1963 or 1964 for Hara-Kiri ; reprinted in Moebius 1/2 (Graphitti Designs, 1991).
